intro: Uvifera laevis, commonly known as the smooth uvifera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
